dcterms:creator: Barry A. Cipra
dcterms:description: The Ising model is a widely-used random model in statistical physics, and we consider vertices on a 35 Ã— 35 grid graph. The spin of each vertex is either up (+1.0) or down (-1.0), which tends to align with an external field but is also influenced by neighboring spins.
dcterms:title: Ising Model

dcterms:creator: Martina Morris
Richard Rothenberg
dcterms:description: The U.S. election map is used for predicting county-level outcomes, where vertices are counties in the U.S. and edges connect bordering counties. Each county has demographic and election statistics.
dcterms:title: U.S. Election Maps

dcterms:creator: Duncan J Watts
Steven H Strogatz
dcterms:description: The transportation networks contain traffic data in the cities of Anaheim and Chicago, where each vertex represents a directed lane, and edges connect lanes based on their types.
dcterms:title: Transportation Networks

dcterms:creator: Martina Morris
Richard Rothenberg
dcterms:description: The sexual interaction network among 1,888 individuals is from an HIV transmission study, where race and sexual orientation are used as vertex features to predict the gender of each person.
dcterms:title: Sexual Interaction Network

dcterms:creator: Benedek Rozemberczki
Carl Allen
Rik Sarkar
dcterms:description: The Twitch dataset represents online friendships amongst Twitch streamers in Portugal, where vertex features are principal components from statistics such as games played and liked, used to predict the logarithm of the number of viewers for each streamer.
dcterms:title: Twitch Social Network
